@mossyair Thank you for your essay, because the glam-grunge overlap cannot be overstated. (More than a little relevant: Duff McKagan is from Seattle and was a big part of the mid-80s scene. He was ready to go pro and deciding between LA and NY, but he knew his car wouldn't make it to NY.)

@marchxness @thenurtureboy @LucindaBliss @Elana_Brooklyn Mother Love Bone may be out, but I love that the two Andrew Wood tributes won here ("Hunger Strike," of course, but also "Would?", which I just learned from Mark Arm's grunge oral history Everybody Loves Our Town and seems incredibly obvious but here we are).

Just exhaled slowly in my apartment. Weird Al was my #2 shortlist pick. I would've voted for him if the other option weren't me, and I don't think he could've asked for a better advocate than @jrobertlennon, so I was sweating right up to the buzzer. https://t.co/YtLUz9GpTR
